definitions.definition: to not continue with a system or plan:
examples: They're considering scrapping the tax and raising the money in other ways.

definitions.definition: to get rid of something that is no longer useful or wanted, often using its parts in new ways:
examples: Hundreds of nuclear weapons have been scrapped.

definitions.definition: old cars and machines or pieces of metal, etc. that are not now needed but have parts that can be used to make other things:
